Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus bud in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved save for band of dots between lines at rim.
Curator's comments: This sherd probably comes from the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.480. For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA68.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1093)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0991) (phase 2)
